title: Output class IDs start from 10 sometimes.
body:
How to reproduce the behaviour
---------
Create a new classification labeling task.
Label some data
Export the data, note the IDs. If you do this multiple times you may find it sometimes numbers from 1, and sometimes from 10

If it output the class strings, or IDs that consistently started from one number of counted up from there I could create models that play nice with the output format. Right now I need to check the output and perform different transformations depending on what shows up.

Perhaps there's some way to configure this under the 'labels' tab? If so I've not been able to find it though

Your Environment
---------
<!-- Include details of your environment. -->

*   Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS
*   Python Version Used: (Ran with docker, should be whatever comes default within the doccano container- not sure how to check)
*   When you install doccano: It can be run without much issue
*   How did you install doccano (Heroku button etc): Docker on a ubuntu machine used remotely on my network
Specifically :
```
docker container create --name doccano   -e "ADMIN_USERNAME=admin"   -e "ADMIN_EMAIL=admin@example.com"   -e "ADMIN_PASSWORD=password"   -p 8000:8000 doccano/doccano
docker container start doccano
```
